section.title: Configuring global syslog-ng options
section.para: The syslog-ng application has a number of global options governing DNS usage, the timestamp format used, and other general points. section.title: Global options
section.para: The following options can be specified in the options statement, as described in .

simplesect.title: bad_hostname()
simplesect.para: Description: A regexp containing hostnames which should not be handled as hostnames.

simplesect.title: chain_hostnames()
simplesect.para: Description: Enable or disable the chained hostname format.

simplesect.title: check_hostname()
simplesect.para: Description: Enable or disable checking whether the hostname contains valid characters.

simplesect.title: create_dirs()
simplesect.para: Description: Enable or disable directory creation for destination files.

simplesect.title: dir_group()
simplesect.para: Description: The default group for newly created directories.

simplesect.title: dir_owner()
simplesect.para: Description: The default owner of newly created directories.

simplesect.title: dns_cache()
simplesect.para: Description: Enable or disable DNS cache usage.

simplesect.title: dns_cache_expire()
simplesect.para: Description: Number of seconds while a successful lookup is cached.

simplesect.title: dns_cache_expire_failed()
simplesect.para: Description: Number of seconds while a failed lookup is cached.

simplesect.title: dns_cache_hosts()
simplesect.para: Description: Name of a file in /etc/hosts format that contains static IP->hostname mappings. Use this option to resolve hostnames locally without using a DNS. Note that any change to this file triggers a reload in syslog-ng and is instantaneous.

simplesect.title: dns_cache_size()
simplesect.para: Description: Number of hostnames in the DNS cache.

simplesect.title: flush_lines()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies how many lines are flushed to a destination at a time. Syslog-ng waits for this number of lines to accumulate and sends them off in a single batch. Setting this number high increases throughput as fully filled frames are sent to the network, but also increases message latency. The latency can be limited by the use of the flush_timeout option.

simplesect.title: flush_timeout()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies the time syslog-ng waits for lines to accumulate in its output buffer. For more information, see the flush_lines() option.

simplesect.title: group()
simplesect.para: Description: The default group of output files. By default, syslog-ng changes the privileges of accessed files (for example /dev/null) to root.root 0600. To disable modifying privileges, use this option with the -1 value.

simplesect.title: log_fifo_size()
simplesect.para: Description: The number of messages that the output queue can store.

simplesect.title: log_msg_size()
simplesect.para: Description: Maximum length of a message in bytes.

simplesect.title: mark() (DEPRECATED)
simplesect.para: Description: The mark_freq() option is an alias for the deprecated mark() option. This is retained for compatibility with syslog-ng version 1.6.x.

simplesect.title: mark_freq()
simplesect.para: Description: An alias for the obsolete mark() option, retained for compatibility with syslog-ng version 1.6.x. The number of seconds between two MARK messages. MARK messages are generated when there was no message traffic to inform the receiver that the connection is still alive. If set to zero (0), no MARK messages are sent. The mark-freq can be set for global option and/or every MARK capable destination driver if mark-mode is periodical or dst-idle or host-idle. If mark-freq isn't defined in the destination, then the mark-freq will be inherited from the global options. If the destination uses internal mark-mode, then the global mark-freq will be valid (does not matter what mark-freq set in the destination side).

simplesect.title: mark_mode()

row.entry: internal | dst-idle | host-idle | periodical | none | global

entry.para: none for file, unix-dgram, unix-stream drivers
global for syslog, tcp, udp destinations

simplesect.para: Description:The mark-mode() option can be set for the following destination drivers: file(), program(), unix_dgram(), unix_stream(), udp(), udp6(), tcp(), tcp6(), pipe(), syslog() and in global option.

listitem.para: internal: When internal mark mode is selected, internal source should be placed in the log path as this mode does not generate mark by itself at the destination. This mode only yelds the mark messages from internal source. This is the mode as syslog-ng 3.x worked. MARK will be generated by internal source if there was NO traffic on local sources:
dst-idle: Sends mark signal if there was NO traffic on destination drivers. Mark signal from internal source will be dropped.
MARK signal can be sent by the following destination drivers: tcp(), udp(), syslog(), program(), file(), pipe(), unix-stream(), unix-dgram().

host-idle: Sends mark signal if there was NO local message on destination drivers. For example mark is generated even if messages were received from tcp. Mark signal from internal source will be dropped.
MARK signal can be sent by the following destination drivers: tcp(), udp(), syslog(), program(), file(), pipe(), unix-stream(), unix-dgram().
periodical: Sends mark signal perodically, regardless of traffic on destination driver. Mark signal from internal source will be dropped.
MARK signal can be sent by the following destination drivers: tcp(), udp(), syslog(), program(), file(), pipe(), unix-stream(), unix-dgram().
none: Destination driver drops all MARK messages. If an explicit mark-mode() is not given to the drivers where none is the default value, then none will be used.
global: Destination driver uses the global mark-mode setting. The syslog-ng interprets syntax error if the global mark-mode is global.

note.para: In case of dst-idle, host-idle and periodical; MARK message will not be written in the destination, if it is not open yet.

simplesect.title: normalize_hostnames()
simplesect.para: Description: Normalize hostnames, which currently translates to converting them to lower case. (requires 1.9.9)

simplesect.title: owner()
simplesect.para: Description: The default owner of output files. By default, syslog-ng changes the privileges of accessed files (for example /dev/null) to root.root 0600. To disable modifying privileges, use this option with the -1 value.

simplesect.title: perm()
simplesect.para: Description: The default permission for output files. By default, syslog-ng changes the privileges of accessed files (for example /dev/null) to root.root 0600. To disable modifying privileges, use this option with the -1 value.

simplesect.title: recv_time_zone()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies the time zone associated with the incoming messages, if not specified otherwise in the message or in the source driver. For details, see also and .

simplesect.title: send_time_zone()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies the time zone associated with the messages sent by syslog-ng, if not specified otherwise in the message or in the destination driver. For details, see .

simplesect.title: stats_freq()
simplesect.para: Description: The period between two STATS messages in seconds. STATS are log messages sent by syslog-ng, containing statistics about dropped log messages. Set to 0 to disable the STATS messages.

simplesect.title: stats_level()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies the detail of statistics syslog-ng collects about the processed messages.

listitem.para: Level 0 collects only statistics about the sources and destinations
Level 1 contains details about the different connections and log files, but has a slight memory overhead
Level 2 contains detailed statistics based on the hostname.
Level 3 contains detailed statistics based on various message parameters like facility, severity, or tags.

simplesect.para: Note that level 2 and 3 increase the memory requirements and CPU load. For details on message statistics, see .

simplesect.title: sync() or sync_freq() (DEPRECATED)
simplesect.para: Description: Obsolete aliases for flush_lines()

simplesect.title: threaded()
simplesect.para: Description: Enable &abbrev; to run in multithreaded mode and use multiple CPUs. Available only in &product; 4 F1&product; 3.3 and later. See for details.

simplesect.title: time_reopen()
simplesect.para: Description: The time to wait in seconds before a dead connection is reestablished.

simplesect.title: time_sleep()
simplesect.para: Description: The time to wait in milliseconds between each invocation of the poll() iteration.

simplesect.title: timestamp_url()
simplesect.para: Description: The URL of the Timestamping Authority used to request timestamps to sign logstore chunks. Note that &abbrev; currently supports only Timestamping Authorities that conform to RFC3161 Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Time-Stamp Protocol, other protocols like Microsoft Authenticode Timestamping are not supported.

simplesect.title: timestamp_policy()
simplesect.para: Description: If the Timestamping Server has timestamping policies configured, specify the OID of the policy to use into the Timestamping policy field. &abbrev; will include this ID in the timestamping requests sent to the TSA. This option is available in &abbrev; 3.1 and later.

simplesect.title: ts_format()
simplesect.para: Description: Specifies the timestamp format used when syslog-ng itself formats a timestamp and nothing else specifies a format (for example: STAMP macros, internal messages, messages without original timestamps). For details, see also .

simplesect.title: use_rcptid()
simplesect.para: Description: The receipt ID function is disabled by default due to performance issues. For details, see also .

simplesect.title: use_time_recvd() (DEPRECATED)

warning.para: This option is not available in &abbrev; version 3.2 and later. Use the R_ prefixed version of the respective macro instead. Starting with &abbrev; version 3.2, the DATE macro equals the S_DATE macro.

simplesect.para: Description: This option controls how the time related macros are expanded in filename and content templates. If set to yes, then the non-prefixed versions of the time related macros (for example: HOUR instead of R_HOUR and S_HOUR) refer to the time when the message was received, otherwise it refers to the timestamp which is in the message.

note.para: The timestamps in the messages are generated by the originating host and might not be accurate.

simplesect.para: This option is deprecated as many users assumed that it controls the timestamp as it is written to logfiles/destinations, which is not the case. To change how messages are formatted, specify a content-template referring to the appropriate prefixed (S_ or R_) time macro.
